context: Act 1 Chapter 1.1 — Arriving at The Pit for the first organized race

lines.text: The warehouse district swallows you whole. No streetlights here — just the glow of phone screens and the amber pulse of cigarettes in cupped hands. Bass thumps from somewhere deep inside the concrete maze, rattling your mirrors.

You turn the corner and The Pit opens up before you. A sunken loading dock ringed by abandoned warehouses, now repurposed as Nova Pacifica's most notorious proving ground. Cars line both sides — thirty, maybe forty — hoods up, engines breathing.
The air is thick with exhaust fumes, cheap beer, and adrenaline. Someone's running a generator for the floodlights. The whole place hums with a frequency you can feel in your teeth.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: I haven't been here in years. Smells the same.

lines.speaker: Maya
lines.text: If you die, I'm not fixing your car for free anymore.
A stocky man with a clipboard and a gold tooth catches you rolling in. He steps in front of your car like he's daring you to keep moving.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Entry fee's five hundred. Cash.
He leans down, peers through your window at the CRX. His eyebrows climb his forehead like they're trying to escape.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: You serious?

lines.label: pit_boss_reacts_serious
lines.text: You hold his gaze. Don't blink. After a beat, the gold tooth flashes in a grin.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Alright. Alright, dead serious. Five hundred.

lines.label: pit_boss_reacts_aggressive
lines.text: His grin vanishes. He taps the clipboard against his palm — slow, deliberate.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: I got problems with everything in this city, kid. Your car just made the list. Five hundred.

lines.label: pit_boss_reacts_silent
lines.text: You count out the bills and push them through the window without a word. He takes them, counts them again, tucks them into the clipboard.

lines.speaker: Pit Boss
lines.text: Quiet type. Fine by me. Quiet types either win or wreck. No in-between.

lines.label: crowd_mocking
lines.text: You pull into the staging area. Heads turn. Not in admiration.

lines.speaker: Crowd Voice
lines.text: Yo, is that a CRX? What year is that thing, 1988?

lines.speaker: Crowd Voice 2
lines.text: Somebody call a tow truck now, save us the wait.
Laughter ripples through the crowd. Someone takes a photo. You can hear the mockery spreading like a current through the bodies pressed against the chain-link fence.

lines.speaker: Crowd Voice 3
lines.text: Hold up — is that...? Nah. Can't be.
You catch the voice but not the face. It came from deep in the crowd. Someone who thought they recognized something — or someone. The moment passes.
A woman with a starter pistol walks to the center of the strip. She raises one hand. The engines around you rise to a scream.
Your hands tighten on the wheel. Your heart hammers against your ribs. The bass from someone's sound system synchs with your pulse. For one perfect, terrifying moment, everything is still.

lines.speaker: Starter
lines.text: RUNNERS READY!
The pistol cracks the night open. Tires scream. The crowd roars. You dump the clutch and the CRX lurches forward like a dog off a chain.
The race is on.
